reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Reduction of morbidity and mortality related to severe acute malnutrition through integrated outpatient therapeutic feeding program(OTP) among IDPs and drought affected host communities in Warsheikh district of Middle Shabelle region.

description.narrative: In this project, QRCS will improve the access and utilization of Emergency integrated Nutrition services for women and children living in the most affected areas in Warsheikh district using 1 static and 1 Mobile site. The project objective contributes to reduction of mortality and morbidity among 8390 beneficiaries: Children U5 (2100 boys and 2450 girls) and 3840 PLWs through treatment of uncomplicated SAM and integrating with basic nutrition service package (BNSP) services linked to WASH and health programs in the affected settlements among Warsheikh district. The project activities will include: Screening and treatment of 3840 pregnant women and lactating women) and 4550 (2100 boys and 2450 girls) with acute malnutrition Screening and treatment of 4550 (2100 boys and 2450 girls) of severe acute malnutrition in children 0-59 months training caretakers on the identification of malnutrition and ensure early action in treatment Training of 14(6 male and 8 female) Nutrition staff on Integrated Management of Acute Malnutrition Training of 14(6 male and 8 female) Nutrition staff in Expanded Program on Immunization and Nutrition Health and Hygiene Promotion Training 10(3 male and 7 female) Community Nutritional Workers in basic Infant Young Child Feeding (IYCF-E) Providing of multiple micro nutrients to 3840 pregnant women and lactating women Provision of 4550 children (2100 boys and 2450 girls) 6-59 months with Multiple Micro Nutrient Supplementation Provide Individual counselling and/or breastfeeding support for 1707 mothers of SAM children admitted to the program Provision of immunization to 4550 children under five (2100 boys and 2450 girls) 6-59 months with penta 3 and measles vaccines Provide Immunization services to 1707 pregnant women with tetanus vaccine Providing 4550 children (2100 boys and 2450 girls) 6-59 months with deworming tablets at the nutrition sites Provide maternal and child health and nutrition promotion messages using billboards and bronchures and other IEC materials

receiver-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs
